snippet.textDisplay: Given it wasn't mentioned, I assume this has the same terrible checkpoint system as all From Software soulslikes (aside from Elden Ring, which is great)?  If a checkpoints is more than a few steps from a boss I just delete the game, I hate doing the same easy areas over and over again.  It sucks that every time there is a new soulslike, I think "maybe this is my chance!" But it never is.

snippet.textDisplay: the number of recycled bosses is huge. literally every major area from souls games have been copy pasted with visual tweaks. the game has a dragon boss that has the size and moveset of midir. there is malenia clone, guardian ape clone, and many major bosses from soul series. its like the devs cant think and create something from their brains. overall a 7/10 at best

snippet.textDisplay: Its absolutely crazy to me that this game loses brownie points for having a hub where you shop and level up. That's been a soulslike staple since the beginning. Also, it's obtuse and annoying to reallocate skill point? you literally just need to hit the undo button and then choose another skill. Bro is fishing hard. He shoulda just said it loses 1 point for being difficult and another point for being a lower budget double A game.
snippet.textOriginal: Its absolutely crazy to me that this game loses brownie points for having a hub where you shop and level up. That's been a soulslike staple since the beginning. snippet.textDisplay: 178 hours in, just finished my first playthrough and got my platinum trophy soon as I started NG+, I rate it a  9.5/10!!! Only because it‚Äôs so buggy and I literally beat the final boss 3 times, all 3 phases, for the game to not glitch out and report an error!!! Then had to do all 24 side quests over AGAIN to get those 3-4 trophies tied in and on the final side quest, my daughter wanted to fight , so I gave her the controller and she went straight to summoning the the advocacy!!! I snatched it so fast!!! I would‚Äôve had to do an entire playthrough all over, just to get the trophy for not summoning (so I thought, I received it already). Fromsoft should definitely tie a trophy in for those that never summon üòÇ
snippet.textOriginal: 178 hours in, just finished my first playthrough and got my platinum trophy soon as I started NG+, I rate it a  9.5/10!!! Only because it‚Äôs so buggy and I literally beat the final boss 3 times, all 3 phases, for the game to not glitch out and report an error!!! Then had to do all 24 side quests over AGAIN to get those 3-4 trophies tied in and on the final side quest, my daughter wanted to fight , so I gave her the controller and she went straight to summoning the the advocacy!!! I snatched it so fast!!! I would‚Äôve had to do an entire playthrough all over, just to get the trophy for not summoning (so I thought, I received it already). Fromsoft should definitely tie a trophy in for those that never summon üòÇ

snippet.textDisplay:
IGN !  What happened? Why the wait? Why the suffering? When the new game drops the very first thing I do is check what IGN gave on scale 1 to 10. No, details, no story, no mechanics, no philosophy, not even graphics, I do not care about those - I just want the damn number.
With all fairness, sometimes it is literally all I do:
Click IGN link
-Scroll or rewind to the score
-Nod or shake head
-Close tab
-Judgment complete ‚òë - circle closed, Universe safe, OCD tamed, rage contained. World once again is good place to be, full of butterflies, flowers and cute rabbits frolicking under radiant warm sun.  

But, then came The First Berserker Khazan...

And IGN made us wait ungodly amount of time just so we could skip the entire review and check the damn number. It was like forever dark eternal winter overrun by living shadows lurking to consume fragile remains of hope we once had . Why IGN?!? Why? I ask again IGN - WHYYYyyyyy... (?)
snippet.textOriginal:

With all fairness, sometimes it is literally all I do:

-Judgment complete ‚òë - circle closed, Universe safe, OCD tamed, rage contained. World once again is good place to be, full of butterflies, flowers and cute rabbits frolicking under radiant warm sun.  

But, then came The First Berserker Khazan...

And IGN made us wait ungodly amount of time just so we could skip the entire review and check the damn number. It was like forever dark eternal winter overrun by living shadows lurking to consume fragile remains of hope we once had . Why IGN?!? Why? I ask again IGN - WHYYYyyyyy... (?)

snippet.textDisplay: This game answers the question "what if an entire game was as hard as elden ring: shadow of the erdtree". The highest of highs and the lowest of lows. snippet.textDisplay: As a huge souls fan, beating bosses in this game is so much more satisfying than most souls bosses. In souls games 1/3 of the bosses are fun but too easy, 1/3 are just annoying and bad, and 1/3 are amazing. I am on the last couple bosses in Khazan and I have enjoyed every single boss so far save for a shield boss that teetered on annoying. That is a crazy lineup for a game with this many bosses. While Sekiro has much better level design I have to say a lot of these bosses are better than most of sekiro‚Äôs. I think it hinges on the fact that so many abilities are actually very useful against bosses and not just normal enemies. I also love that the brutal attack is part of your build and you can choose to focus on health or stamina depletion. What you choose to pour into will totally change the pace of boss fights. Ultimately, fights feel fair and square because there are no super OP cheese methods (that I know of) and similar to Sekiro you are forced to get gud. Your first 10 attempts on a boss you with be pissed as hell but your last few attempts you will be whooping their ass. I legit let myself die at the end of a few fights just so I could keep playing it. I already know 3 people who bounced off this shit because of viper but for me it just clicks.
snippet.textOriginal: As a huge souls fan, beating bosses in this game is so much more satisfying than most souls bosses. In souls games 1/3 of the bosses are fun but too easy, 1/3 are just annoying and bad, and 1/3 are amazing. I am on the last couple bosses in Khazan and I have enjoyed every single boss so far save for a shield boss that teetered on annoying. That is a crazy lineup for a game with this many bosses. While Sekiro has much better level design I have to say a lot of these bosses are better than most of sekiro‚Äôs. I think it hinges on the fact that so many abilities are actually very useful against bosses and not just normal enemies. I also love that the brutal attack is part of your build and you can choose to focus on health or stamina depletion. What you choose to pour into will totally change the pace of boss fights. Ultimately, fights feel fair and square because there are no super OP cheese methods (that I know of) and similar to Sekiro you are forced to get gud. Your first 10 attempts on a boss you with be pissed as hell but your last few attempts you will be whooping their ass. I legit let myself die at the end of a few fights just so I could keep playing it. I already know 3 people who bounced off this shit because of viper but for me it just clicks.

snippet.textDisplay: I love games that just give me great combat and a superb leveling system that motivates me to get as high as I can before I get capped out. I really only enjoy FromSoft games because of that but I‚Äôm happy to see other developers making games that give me that same feeling. If I want story I‚Äôll pop on a movie or play RDR2.
snippet.textOriginal: I love games that just give me great combat and a superb leveling system that motivates me to get as high as I can before I get capped out. I really only enjoy FromSoft games because of that but I‚Äôm happy to see other developers making games that give me that same feeling. If I want story I‚Äôll pop on a movie or play RDR2.
